admission_text:
## Membership Benefits:

## Join the preservationists that came before you in becoming 

## a member of our 88+ year old preservation non-profit today!

[Become a Member](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201180542/https://gardenia-bird-xw5a.squarespace.com/checkout/donate?donatePageId=5f247205743e2602d9a3894b)

​

  1. ### Free unlimited admission to all four of our historic house museums

  2. ### Special members-only events (geared toward each level of giving)

  3. ### Priority access to our general public events, including free or discounted tickets

  4. ### Special members-only offers from our PhilaLandmarks’ partners: Hidden City Philadelphia, Cliveden, Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia Opera Collaborative, Ghost Tours of Philadelphia (and more!)

  5. ### Recognition in our Annual Report 

  6. ### All applications will be reviewed by the staff, and may be recommended to the Board of Trustees for potential election to membership

### 

### 

$25 Young Friend: benefits for one individual 39 years or younger

$50 Individual: benefits for one individual

$85 Family: benefits for 2 adults and all children 17 & under

$100 Sustainer: benefits for 2 adults + guest privileges (2) for access to all 

PhilaLandmarks houses + all NARM benefits ([http://narmassociation.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201180542/http://narmassociation.org/)) giving you access to 900 arts, cultural, and historical institutions and more! 

[Become a Member today!](http://web.archi...
collections_text:
## Historic Chester County. A Family Refuge. And a "Mad" General. 

### HISTORIC WAYNESBOROUGH

HW fall leaves sign.jpg

press to zoom

HW sign.jpg

press to zoom

HW House.jpg

press to zoom

HW winterjpg.jpg

press to zoom

HW room2.jpg

press to zoom

HW room.jpg

press to zoom

HW mantle.jpg

press to zoom

HW general anthony wayne by Edward Savage.jpg

press to zoom

HW spring house.jpg

press to zoom

Show More

When Captain Anthony Wayne arrived in Pennsylvania with his family in 1724, he was likely looking for a bit of peace in the land he purchased in Chester County after his valiant service to William of Orange at the Battle of the Boyne. 

His son Isaac would serve as an officer in the French and Indian War. But it was Isaac’s son Anthony who would earn the legendary moniker “Mad" Anthony Wayne as he served with General Washington and Lafayette, helping lead the battles of Brandywine and Germantown. 

The Valley Forge encampment was a mere five miles from his doorstep. By the end of the War for Independence, General Wayne became a bonafide national hero, and is today still credited as one of the greatest fighting generals in American History. 

In all, seven generations of Waynes lived on site until 1965. Visitors to this beautiful Georgian manor will find a fascinating collection of 18th and 19th C. family items, including General Wayne’s personal map from the Paoli Massacre. 

[Private Event Rental](http://web.archive.org/web/20221201164819/https://www.philalandm...
